_header: A tale of this feast have I heard / How it once of a widow fared
Note: Another version of this miracle occurs in the section on the Purification in 2908.
_description: The Widow’s Candle, in the Northern Homily Cycle (Purification) — in couplets

BodSelSup52.First Lines:
A lytyll merakyll I wyll yow sayþat be fell all þis
                    heyȝt day…
BodSelSup52.Last Lines:
…þat tals of hyr qwen þei haue redschewys þem
                    all after in ded

BodAsh42.First Lines:
A tale of þis feste haue i herdeHow it ones of a widowe
                    ferde…
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…þat bare of hir bodye þat birtheþat boȝt
                    man kinde to menske & myrthe

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
A Tale of þis feste I haue herdHou hit of a wydewe
                    ferd…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And asken hire Merci riht InwardlyHe may beo syker of
                    Merci
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title: Hou vr lady gaf a good wyf a sherge (f. 178ra)

                    heih dayIt was a widowe witerlyÞat mekil lufed oure swete
                    lady…
CULAdd8335.Last Lines:

CULDd11.First Lines:

                    ferd…
CULDd11.Last Lines:

CULDd11.Note:
Break between preceding text (2516) and this (168) occurs two
                    lines earlier in this MS.

CULGg531.First Lines:
A talle of þis feste haue I hardeHow gates it of a wydow
                    farde…
CULGg531.Last Lines:
…And aske hyre helpe ryght inwardlyHe may be sykyr of hyre
                    mercy
CULGg531.Note:
Break between this (169) and following text (5161) occurs two lines later in
                    this MS, so last two lines according to this witness are ‘Þat may
                    ȝe se by a leuedy / Þat was abbas of a Nunry’ (=first two lines
                    of 5161).
